skill.name: global-tech-stack
skill.description: Understand and adhere to the project's technology stack including Laravel, PHP, React, PostgreSQL, Pest, Tailwind CSS, and all configured tools and services. Use this skill when making architectural decisions, when choosing libraries or packages, when configuring development tools, when setting up testing frameworks, when implementing authentication, when integrating third-party services, when configuring CI/CD pipelines, when setting up local development environments, or when ensuring consistency with the established tech stack across all parts of the application.
skill.summary: Ensure Claude Code follows your Laravel, React, and PHP technology stack standards
skill.author: DevanB

content.user_title: Enforce Your Laravel and React Tech Stack Standards
content.value_statement: When working on projects with specific technology requirements, Claude Code needs guidance to make consistent architectural decisions. This skill ensures Claude Code adheres to your established Laravel, PHP, React, PostgreSQL, and tooling standards across all development tasks.
actual_capabilities: Guide Claude Code to use your specified Laravel and PHP frameworks
Ensure consistent selection of libraries and packages aligned with your tech stack
Provide context for PostgreSQL database and Eloquent ORM usage patterns
Reference Pest testing framework conventions for writing tests
Inform decisions about Tailwind CSS, React, and frontend tooling
Point to external documentation defining your technology standards
limitations: Requires a separate documentation file defining the actual tech stack details
Does not enforce standards automatically, only provides guidance to Claude Code
Effectiveness depends on the quality of referenced documentation
May need updates when your technology stack changes

use_cases.title: Full-Stack Development Teams
use_cases.description: Teams building Laravel and React applications can ensure all AI-assisted code follows established patterns for database access, testing frameworks, and frontend libraries.

use_cases.title: Laravel Project Standardization
use_cases.description: Projects using specific Laravel tools like Herd, Telescope, Fortify, and Pint can ensure Claude Code recommends and implements features using the correct toolchain.

use_cases.title: Onboarding New Developers
use_cases.description: New team members can rely on Claude Code to suggest approaches that align with project conventions for CI/CD, third-party services, and development environments.

prompt_templates.title: Check Tech Stack Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my authentication implementation and ensure it follows our global tech stack standards
prompt_templates.scenario: Verifying existing code matches your technology standards

prompt_templates.title: Guide Library Selection
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add email functionality. What package should I use based on our tech stack?
prompt_templates.scenario: Selecting dependencies aligned with your standards

prompt_templates.title: Configure Testing Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a new Pest test for my User model following our testing standards
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating tests that match your framework conventions

prompt_templates.title: Architect New Feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a caching layer for user sessions using our approved tech stack including Redis and PostgreSQL
prompt_templates.scenario: Planning architecture with multiple technologies from your stack

output_examples.input: What testing framework should I use for this Laravel project?
output_examples.output: Based on your global tech stack standards, you should use Pest for testing this Laravel project. Pest is configured as the standard testing framework and provides an elegant syntax for writing tests.

output_examples.input: How should I handle email sending in this application?
output_examples.output: According to your tech stack documentation, you should use Resend for email functionality. This is the approved third-party service for email in your stack.

best_practices: Maintain up-to-date documentation in the referenced tech stack file
Use this skill when making any architectural or tooling decisions
Reference the skill before selecting third-party packages or services
anti_patterns: Ignoring the tech stack guidance and choosing tools arbitrarily
Failing to update the documentation when your stack evolves
Using the skill without maintaining the external documentation it references

faq.question: Does this skill automatically enforce my tech stack?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance to Claude Code about your standards. Claude Code will reference this when making decisions, but you should still review suggestions.

faq.question: What technologies does this skill cover?
faq.answer: This skill covers Laravel, PHP, React, PostgreSQL, Pest testing, Tailwind CSS, Redis, and related tools like Herd, Telescope, Fortify, and Pint.

faq.question: Do I need additional documentation files?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill references an external file that should contain your detailed tech stack standards and conventions.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with other frameworks?
faq.answer: This specific skill is designed for Laravel and React stacks. You would need to modify it for other frameworks.

faq.question: How does Claude Code use this skill?
faq.answer: When making architectural decisions or choosing libraries, Claude Code will consult this skill to understand your preferred technologies and patterns.

faq.question: What if the referenced documentation file is missing?
faq.answer: The skill will still provide basic guidance about the listed technologies, but effectiveness is reduced without detailed documentation.
